surface_layer.definition: A sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services in an economy over a period of time.

deep_layer.mechanism: Aggregate demand exceeding supply, increased production costs, or monetary expansion.

core_premise: General prices increase over time, reducing purchasing power.

MECHANISM: Demand-Pull Inflation: Aggregate demand exceeds aggregate supply.
Cost-Push Inflation: Increased production costs cause producers to raise prices.
Monetary Expansion: An increase in the money supply reduces the purchasing power of currency.

claims.object: Demand-Pull Inflation: Aggregate demand exceeds aggregate supply.
Cost-Push Inflation: Increased production costs cause producers to raise prices.
Monetary Expansion: An increase in the money supply reduces the purchasing power of currency.
